div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1006 Olbia (mod. Parutino), Ochakov (750) raion, Nikolaev oblast, Ukraine, 1905 Burial: 400-350 B.C.? Contents: 108 AE. With a black-glazed plate Olbia: aes grave Disposition: Leningrad 15 (as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 3 [8], 4 [7]) Bertier de la Garde, NS (Russian) 1911, p. 90 (describes coins as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 2) Further information from IU. Diukov (Her- mitage material) The Hermitage records of B. V. Farma- kovskii show that the 15 coins there were part of a hd. found at Olbia in 1905. Details of the hd.'s discovery coincide with those given by Bertier de la Garde, ruling out the possibility of two different hoards
